item.title: Research on the Effects of Different Policy Tools on China’s Energy Conservation and Emissions Reduction Innovation Based on the Panel Data of 285 prefectural-level municipalities(Chinese)
The Assement platform of urban forest ecosystem servcie based on InVEST model and IOT
The Criminal Geographical Analysis about Walking Environment of Urban
Transportation Planning of Smart City on the Basis of Data Augmentation Design Under the Perspective of Humanism: A Case Study of Fuzhou’S Cangshan District
item.description:
The papers won the National Third Prize during the “Smart City” Special Competition of 14th “Challenge Cup” National College Student Curricular Academic Science and Technology Works Competition.

Under the storm of global informatization, development of smart city draws much attention and smart transportation is the root. For the city of Fuzhou’s Cangsang district is one of the earliest pilot smart cities and the place to hold the national youth games, this study takes it as the target area and makes a transportation plan based on data augmentation design.

item.title: The Simulation Analysis of Waterlogging and the Sponge City Planning Control of Central Urabn Area in Fuzhou City
The Simulation Analysis of Waterlogging and the Sponge City Planning Control of Central Urabn Area in Fuzhou City(Chinese)
Note of Applied Statistics with R
Sponge city planning research in the view of landscape anslysis
item.description:
The research extracted the impervious surface from the non-NGI(natural green infrastructure ) landscape and used the precipitation-volumetric method to simulate waterlogging scenarios. We determined the area of rainwater submersion by simulation experiments, the change in the NGI landscape by overlaying images of the region, and the association between these features by data mining. Using the change in ecology indices, we ascertained the changing spatial patterns of the NGI landscape and used these findings to formulate suggestions for Sponge City planning in Fuzhou. Overall, our work combines three research themes, urban waterlogging, landscape ecology, and data mining, for a deep analysis of the relationship between the NGI landscape and storm runoff in an urban environment.

Our research results are inculded in the 2016 International Low Impact Development Conference Abstracts Proceedings and display at the 2016 International Low Impact Development Conference. Our research papers are included in the “Proceedings of 2016 International Low Impact Development Conference-China”. The Organizing Committee have negotiated the publication of conference papers as an American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) special Proceedings. The ASCE Proceedings is EI-indexed and is very widely recognized world-wide.

item.title: The Optimization Model of High Education Staff’s Refuge Space Under Earthquake Disater
item.description:
Earthquake is a devastating natural disaster, The seismic refuge has become the research focus in the world. Status quo of Qishan campus of Fujian Normal University earthquake disaster prone and vulnerability based on, The campus network model using L-A coupled seismic refuge constrained model and the evaluation method of MCE deployment optimization research. The results are as follows. 1）The principle of combining with national disaster in earthquake emergency shelter planning based on planning, 20 earthquake emergency shelter. 2）Fujian Normal University college student population spatial distribution pattern showed uneven spatial distribution, the characteristics of the North south. Under different time scales and different obvious spatial agglomeration. 3) According to the spatial and temporal distribution of proposed model assumptions, in different time scales according to different locations of the evacuation route analysis. And the crowd under earthquake disaster evacuation of about 64.412m/min by using the MCE evaluation method and entropy method. According to the evaluation method of MCE results, the use of L-A network constraint model to evaluate campus earthquake evacuation capability. The whole campus evacuation capability is weak, scenario simulation refuge accommodate the number of students is 18638, the shelter utilization rate is only 30%. The need for further planning and construction of disaster prevention and mitigation.

L-A network model, The temporal and spatial distribution pattern of population, MCE evaluation, The University Campus

item.title: The Simulation Model of Building Site Location and Construction Based on Data Augmented Design and BIM: A Case Study of Fujian Normal University
item.description:
With the tide of Smart City and Big Data era, I explore the practice of Data Augmented Design、GIS and BIM in Smart Campus’s Application based on Fujian Normal University Keji Buildings. I build the simulation model of building site location and construction. And I use Data Augmented Design, GIS spatial analysis, Space Syntax and City Engine 3D modeling to support the building site location and assessment of planning, build the BIM model and develop the public participation GIS of Keji Buildings. The result shows, 1) The location based on multi-source GIS data and principle of sustainable development. It has high reliability and offer a case study of building location in campus. The result of Space Syntax showed that the location has the higher choice and integration than others. It’s quite believable on the basis of quantitative analysis. 2)The BIM which based on CGA rules includes indoor and outdoor models. The building information models and collision detection tools could help the constructors solve the problem like pipeline collision. 3)The System of Smart Campus Public Participation could provide the functions of public participation based on VR and simulation analysis of sunlight. It aimed better decision-making and management.

BIM; GIS; The simulation model of building site location and construction; Data Augmented Design

View swipe.

Solar analysis.

Shortest Path.

Indoor design.

Report.

Collision detection.

item.title: The Virtual 3D model of Fuzhou Strait Olympic Sports Center
item.description:
The research built up the virtual 3D model of Fuzhou strait olmpic sports center. At the same time, our research includes the planning of the surrounding infrastructure. Eespecially, we use City Engine to construct our variable model(different styles of building) to create greater values.

3D model of Stadium.

Different styles of buildings.

Detection of illegal construction.
